introduction: Predictive modeling in education: Using machine learning to detect students who game the system.

sections.title: Section 1: Introduction to Predictive Modeling
content: Explanation of predictive modeling as a category of machine learning.
Discussion of supervised learning and predicting specific aspects of data.
Example of gaming behavior and label collection for analysis.

sections.title: Section 2: Collecting and Analyzing Gaming Behavior Data
content: Description of the data collection process, including labels and hints.
Explanation of using data to build a model for predicting gaming behavior.
Example of the first row of the table and analysis of the student's behavior.

sections.title: Section 3: Using the Model for Prediction
content: Description of using the model to predict gaming behavior based on student data.
Explanation of using cross-validation for model improvement.
Example of the prediction results using the model.

sections.title: Section 4: Applications of Predictive Modeling in Education
content: Discussion of various applications of predictive modeling in education, such as studying behavior and learning outcomes.
Example of using the model to inform teachers about student gaming behavior.
Explanation of using the model to drive automated interventions in the system.
